```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r library load}
library(SingleR)
library(dplyr)
library(SeuratObject)
library(Seurat)
library(singlet)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(RcppML)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r normalization}
LogNormalize("Moreen's_data$bed")
LogNormalize("Moreen's_data$bath")
LogNormalize("Moreen's_data$Sqfoot")
LogNormalize("Moreen's_data$Acrs_lot")
LogNormalize("Moreen's_data$price")


view("Moreen's_data")



```

```{r splitting the data}

set.seed(37645)
Seperator <- rbinom(nrow("Moreen's_data"), 1, 0.25)
"Test_data" <- "Moreen's_data"[Seperator == 1]

"Moreen's data"

```
